meanings.definition: A person or thing that teases or annoys.
meanings.sent1: The teasers in the class always made jokes to annoy others.
meanings.sent2: The little brother was a teaser, always poking fun at his siblings.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy was a teaser, constantly stealing socks for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her mischievous cat was a teaser, batting at her shoelaces as she walked.
meanings.sent5: The persistent teaser at work would always play pranks on his colleagues.

meanings.definition: A short introductory advertisement or preview.
meanings.sent1: The TV show had exciting teasers to get viewers interested.
meanings.sent2: Before the movie started, they showed teasers for upcoming films.
meanings.sent3: The teaser for the new product left customers eager to learn more.
meanings.sent4: The teaser trailer revealed just enough to spark curiosity.
meanings.sent5: The teaser poster featured a mysterious silhouette to build anticipation.

meanings.definition: A puzzle or riddle designed to challenge or entertain.
meanings.sent1: The teasers in the newspaper were always fun to solve.
meanings.sent2: During the party, they enjoyed sharing brain teasers with each other.
meanings.sent3: The tricky teaser stumped even the most clever of the group.
meanings.sent4: The teaser at the end of the book left readers guessing until the last page.
meanings.sent5: The challenging teaser required logic and creativity to solve.
